title: Militants Strike Baghdad And Northern City In Iraq
teaser: Violence erupted in Iraq today when Islamic State fighters attacked a crowded market with double suicide bombs.
contentencoded:
Violence erupted in Iraq today when Islamic State fighters attacked a crowded market with double suicide bombs, killing more than a dozen people. Islamic State fighters also attacked the city of Kirkuk, killing a high-ranking Iraqi soldier.

NPR’s Alice Fordham joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson from Baghdad with details on the attacks, what life has been like there recently and where the U.S. and coalition efforts may be headed.

Guest

  • Alice Fordham, international correspondent based in Beirut, Lebanon, for NPR. She tweets @AliceFordham.
